intro: Astragalus issatissensis, commonly known as the Issatiss Mountain milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers, which is essential for its survival in dry climates. Astragalus issatissensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native range.
